result.execSummary:
The defendant Zulma D Mercado Rodriguez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.   Sign releases for agent.  Inform agent of all prescriptions.

No Contact with the JC Penny store or any victim or witnesses listed in the criminal complaint. Maintain employment and/or school combination. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Straight Time. Sentence credit of 12 days were granted. LAST 33 days are Stayed - To be used at agent's discretion.

Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Zulma D Mercado Rodriguez in court, in custody, with Attorney Eryn M Menden.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts #1 & 2.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1 & 2.  Counts #3 and 4 are dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Menden makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:   IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:

60 DAYS JAIL STRAIGHT TIME  *CONCURRENT* 

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS   -  TRANSFER ALLOWED TO MILWAUKEE COUNTY - 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: J C Penny store listed in criminal complaint or any witnesses listed in criminal complaint 

COSTS:  $253.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  45 Days straight time (12 days credit) - LAST 33 DAYS STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion


COUNT #2:   IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:

60 DAYS JAIL STRAIGHT TIME  *CONCURRENT* 

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS   -  TRANSFER ALLOWED TO MILWAUKEE COUNTY - 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: J C Penny store listed in criminal complaint or any witnesses listed in criminal complaint 

COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 19, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Zulma D Mercado Rodriguez in court, in custody, with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears as friend of the court.   Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Bail remains as fixed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to be seen by the public defender.  Hearing scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
